clinical_study.brief_title: Mobile Transmission of Prehospital Vital Signs to the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: Telemedical Solutions in Medical Emergencies, Advantages and Disadvantages for Patients, Healthcare Professionals, and the Healthcare System: Study 1: "Mobile Transmission of Prehospital Vital Signs to the Emergency Department - Effect on Patient Outcomes, Treatment and Diagnosis"

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine if real time transmission of vital signs, ECG and chat communication between the prehospital ambulances and the emergency department has an effect on patient mortality, ICU admission, hospitalization time, time to doctor, time to treatment and time to diagnostics

primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from arrival to first patient-physician contact, assessed up to 36 months
primary_outcome.description: Time from the patient arrival registered in the patients' logistics system (Cetrea) to registered first patient/physician contact registered in the same patients logistics system.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from arrival to administration of first iv. antibiotics, assessed up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the patient arrival registered in the patients' logistics system (Cetrea) to first administered iv antibiotics registered in the patient's hospital record

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time form arrival at the emergency department to completion of x-ray requisition form, assessed up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the patient arrival registered in the patients' logistics system (Cetrea) to completion of x-ray requisition form registered in the radiologic logistics system (Kodak RIS, 2010 edition)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from arrival to admission to the ICU, assessed up to 36 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the patient arrival registered in the patients' logistics system (Cetrea) to time of admission to the ICU registered in the patient's hospital record. .

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During present hospitalization, assessed up to 36 months

other_outcome.measure: Emergency department staff evaluation of usability of equipment
other_outcome.time_frame: At the time of using the equipment, assessed up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: The staff at the emergency department fill out a survey after the use of the equipment which provides ecg, vital signs, chat.

other_outcome.measure: Ambulance staff evaluation of usability of equipment
other_outcome.time_frame: At the time of using the equipment, assessed up to 36 months
other_outcome.description: The ambulance staff fill out a survey after the use of the equipment which provides ecg, vital signs, chat.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Transmission of vital signs, ecg, chat
arm_group.description: Data from patients transported in ambulances with equipment which enables real time transmission of vital signs, ecg and chat from ambulances to the emergency department.
Patient transported with conventional ambulances without the possibility to transmit real time patient related data.

intervention.intervention_name: Real time transmission of patient related data. Device used: MobiMed 3.1, manufactured by Ortivus AB Sweden
intervention.arm_group_label: Transmission of vital signs, ecg, chat
intervention.other_name: Vital signs, ECG and Chat-messaging delivered real time from prehospital ambulances to the receiving emergency dept.
